name: polyphonic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
consisting of several different tunes that are played or sung at the same time, or relating to or producing such a sound: polyphonic ringtones a 32-voice polyphonic synthesizer See
polyphony
More examplesFewer examplesVirtually all Romantic music is in the strictest sense polyphonic. Renaissance choral music is an intricately woven, polyphonic fabric of multiple voice parts moving semi-independently.The smartphone boasts dual polyphonic speakers.
